triples.name: Level of analysis
triples.relevance: Marr's levels-of-analysis framework is a foundational concept that the paper extends to multiple areas of psychology.

triples.name: Cognitive psychology
triples.relevance: The paper revisits Marr's framework originally developed for cognitive psychology and discusses extending it to other areas.

triples.name: Social psychology
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how to extend Marr's framework to social psychology as a new application area.

triples.name: Developmental psychology
triples.relevance: The paper mentions extending Marr's framework to developmental psychology as one of the fields that could benefit from this approach.

triples.name: Evolutionary psychology
triples.relevance: The paper discusses extending Marr's framework to evolutionary psychology as another application area for the methodology.

triples.name: Philosophy of psychology
triples.relevance: The paper draws on philosophy of psychological explanation as the foundation for its theoretical approach.

triples.name: Psychological capacity
triples.relevance: The paper proposes focusing on psychological capacities as the primary explananda for psychological science.

triples.name: Theoretical cycle
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the theoretical cycle as a novel methodology for building theories with plausibility before empirical testing.
